title: Business Live: Global markets rally - BBC News
summary: m & s outsources half its it team .
us , uk and japanese stocks hit highs .
reports say aston martin planning ipo .

documents.title: goodnight
text: that 's it from us for now , but do n't worry we 'll be back at 6am sharp tomorrow morning .
check in then to find out how supermarket giant sainsbury 's fared over the key christmas trading period .
we 'll also have results from high street fashion chains ted baker and supergroup as well as housebuilder taylor wimpey .

documents.title: steve bannon quits breitbart news
text: ex-trump strategist steve bannon has stepped down from the right-wing breitbart news organisation where he built his reputation .
the move comes amid a furore over remarks he reportedly made about president donald trump 's son .
he described a meeting in new york with a russian lawyer during the 2016 presidential election campaign as `` treasonous '' .

documents.title: yet another record for wall street
text: wall street has etched up yet another record high , marking the sixth day in a row that all three major indexes have closed at all-time highs .
this time health and banking shares were the big drivers pushing stocks higher .
by the end of the day , the dow jones industrial average stood at 25,390.89 , up 0.4 % .
the s & p 500 gained 0.2 % to end the day at 2,751.78 , while the nasdaq advanced 0.1 % to 7,161.71 .

documents.title: world economy back at pre-crisis levels
text: the world bank says global economic growth is likely to strengthen this year , after turning out better than expected in 2017 .
the report says 2018 will be the first year since the financial crisis when the world economy has been operating at or close to its full potential .
but world bank president jim yong kim also warned against complacency .
the bank says weak investment and an ageing workforce mean that the world economy 's capacity to produce goods and services is growing more slowly than before the crisis .
read the full story here .

documents.title: m & s staff 'do n't have a voice '
text: marks and spencer 's decision to outsource 250 tech jobs - albeit those workers will stay in the uk - is part of major changes underway at the retailer .
`` the staff do n't feel they have a voice because the company continues to refuse to recognise an independent trade union , '' said dave gill , national officer of shopworkers ' union usdaw .
`` usdaw is the union for all m & s staff and we urge the company to end their longstanding refusal to meet with us . ''
m & s staff `` must be properly represented , particularly as the business continues to close stores , make redundancies and off-shore jobs , '' he added .

documents.title: picture perfect
text: shares in kodak have more than doubled after the one-time photography pioneer became the latest firm to jump on the cryptocurrency bandwagon .
the 125 year-old company - which emerged from bankruptcy in 2013 - said it was launching a cryptocurrency called `` kodakcoin '' to use for image rights .
the bbc 's new york business editor says it shares are now up 132 % .

documents.title: us oil price at three year-high
text: over on the markets , the price of us crude oil has touched its highest level since december 2014 at just over $ 63 a barrel .
it comes despite predictions that us crude production is expected to climb to more than 10 million barrels per day early this year , reaching that milestone for the first time since 1970 .
it 's then expected to continue to surge into 2019 to a record high , the u.s. energy information administration said .

documents.title: big week for m & s
text: the announcement that marks & spencer is outsourcing more than half its it team is just the start of what will be a big week for the retailer .
on thursday we 'll find out how the clothing and food store fared over christmas .
m & s shares were up 2.4 % today - making it one of the biggest winners on the ftse 100 .
that was on the back of strong christmas sales for supermarket morrisons , and figures from nielsen suggesting that shoppers spent almost £ 500m more on groceries in december than a year before .
but m & s shares dropped last week when department store debenhams issued a profit warning , suggesting investors are n't quite sure which way it 'll go yet .

documents.title: boeing books record jet sales
text: boeing says it delivered an industry-record 763 commercial planes last year .
the tally puts the us company on course to retain the title of world 's biggest plane maker ahead of european rival airbus .
boeing shares rose 2.5 % to $ 318 , giving it a market value of more than $ 180bn .

documents.title: m & s outsourcing 'more than half ' its it team
text: a bit more detail on marks & spencer 's plans to outsource more than half its 430-strong it team to indian tech giant tata consultancy services .
the retailer intends to retain a small in-house it team of about 170 people following the overhaul .
it 's part of a five-year turnaround plan by chief executive steve rowe , which is already seeing the closure of some clothing stores and a withdrawal from international markets .
mr rowe said the tech changes would enable m & s `` to be more agile , flexible and responsive '' and save £ 30m a year .

documents.title: virgin 's daily mail ban 'to do with brexit '
text: virgin trains has stopped stocking the daily mail on its west coast route .
the firm said it made the decision after staff expressed concern about the paper 's editorial stance - on issues such as immigration , lgbt rights and unemployment .

but one of the mail 's consultant editors , andrew pierce , believes a different reason lay behind virgin 's decision : `` what they omitted of course from this statement was saying of course the daily mail supported brexit .

`` and the only three newspapers they 're going to continue to stock on their trains are the daily mirror , the financial times and the times - three very pro-remain papers , as was sir richard branson , '' he added .

documents.title: trump 'could be sin-binned from twitter '
text: in case you missed it , twitter 's european chief bruce daisley spoke to emma barnett on radio 5 live earlier .
he was asked if donald trump could ever be banned from twitter .
there are circumstances - e.g .
revealing a person 's number or address - where he would be cautioned , mr daisley said .
but he added that twitter `` does n't want to become the story '' by sin-binning the elected leader of a major country .

twitter boss @ twitterid tells @ twitterid there are situations where @ twitterid could be sin-binned from the site , if he broke twitter 's rules - eg by tweeting someone 's private address or phone number # emmabarnettshow
looking and sounding good brucey .
bravo .
doxxing bad threatening nuclear war good
toby young ?

documents.title: m & s outsources 250 tech jobs
text: marks & spencer - a stalwart of the uk high street - is transferring 250 technology staff to indian firm tata consultancy services .
a spokeswoman said the staff would remain at its offices in stockley park outside london , but be employed by tata .
the company estimates that the outsourcing of those jobs , and the transfer of core services from eight large suppliers to tata , will bring in annual savings of £ 30m by 2021 .
it is speaking to 30 staff directly about how their jobs will be carried out differently in the future .

documents.title: kodak gets into bitcoin
text: photography firm kodak became a byword for companies which fail to keep up with new technologies when it sank into bankruptcy in 2012 .
it re-emerged the following year as a much smaller business focused on selling printing equipment and services .
kodak has now hit the headlines again .
this time for announcing it 's getting into cryptocurrencies by launching the `` kodakcoin '' for image rights .
it 's sent shares in kodak soaring , although the firm is still only worth $ 190m compared to more than $ 30bn back in the 1990s .
# kodak ( remember it ? )
announces it 's getting into # blockchaintechnology it 's share price jumped at one point by 70 % .
as of 5mins ago it 's up 30 % .
it makes you wonder which other near-death companies could be revived ?
revived ?
i hope you 're joking
maybe just a small rev not a revival
@ twitterid i told you blockchain is the future although i doubt kodak is
wonder when # ge is gunna jump on the boat lmao # blockchain # crypto
england cricket limited ?
oh no .
sorry .
that 's definitely dead .
in the board room that are enjoying this `` kodak moment ``

documents.title: 'jumping on the bandwagon '
text: the new year stock rally shows no sign of wearing off just yet .
all three of the major us indexes have reached record highs yet again , after the uk 's ftse 100 notched a new lifetime high and japan 's nikkei closed at its best level for 26 years .

`` it 's the same old story on wall street whereby traders remain optimistic about the us economy on the back of the pro-business tax reforms that were approved last month , '' said david madden of cmc markets .
`` the momentum is clearly behind the bulls and it appears that more buyers are jumping on the bandwagon . ''

documents.title: us presidents tend to avoid davos
text: donald trump is set to break with another tradition by speaking at davos .
historically , most sitting us presidents do n't go to the annual economic gathering .
the first to appear in davos was bill clinton in 2000 , at the forum 's 30th anniversary session .
he 's been a regular attendee in most years since .
before that , ronald reagan joined the davos crowd several times - but only via video link .
president george bush - father and son - never came to the village in the swiss mountains , and president barack obama was a davos no-show as well .

documents.title: davos : which other big names are going ?
text: donald trump is the latest - and biggest - of the big names reported to be attending davos this year .

others who are rumoured to be going to the annual gathering of the global elite include uk prime minister theresa may , india prime minister narendra modi , argentina president mauricio macri and french president emmanuel macron .

documents.title: breakingtrump to attend davos
text: president trump is set to attend the world economic forum at davos later this month , an administration official says .
sarah huckabee sanders , the white house press secretary , said the president was looking forward to attending the event for world leaders and business executives .
the president welcomes opportunities to advance his america first agenda with world leaders , '' ms sanders said .
the forum - seen as a gathering of the global elite - starts in the swiss ski resort on tuesday 23 january .

documents.title: ftse finishes at new record - just
text: the uk 's ftse 100 index has crept to a fresh record of 7,731.02 , beating the previous high set on friday of 7,724.20 .
retailers sainsbury 's and marks & spencer were two of the biggest winners - rising 3.1 % and 2.4 % respectively - after analysts at nielsen said supermarkets had a positive christmas .

documents.title: greek protesters storm labour ministry
text: greek demonstrators have stormed the country 's labour ministry and confronted its chief in protest at moves to restrict the right to strike .
greece 's left-wing government is set to introduce legislation which could limit the frequency of strikes as a condition set by international creditors in exchange for bailout funds .
using crowbars , about 500 demonstrators with greek communist-affiliated group pame prised open metal shutters of the labour ministry in central athens .
they raced up to the eighth floor of the building where about 50 of them came face to face with labour minister effie achtsioglou ( where they shouted `` shame on you '' .

documents.title: twitter executive calls for more free speech
text: the head of twitter in europe , the middle east and africa has defended its place as a platform for controversial views .
the social networking site recently introduced new rules against inappropriate content and behaviour .
bruce daisley says it gives an opportunity for both sides to express their views , and challenge each other .
`` our start point has been that actually the best way to challenge free speech is more free speech .
is to hold it to account in public , '' he told the bbc .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: microsoft halts patches for chip bugs
text: microsoft has halted some patches for the meltdown and spectre chip bugs after some customers complained that the software updates froze their machines .
the flaw in computer chips affects billions of pcs , smartphones and tablets around the world .
specific fixes for the bugs on windows 10 , windows 8.1 and windows 7 had caused some machines to suffer blue-screen errors , microsoft said .
in a blogpost , microsoft said that it would resume fixes `` as soon as possible '' .

documents.title: wall street at record highs
text: another day , another record for us stock markets .
the dow jones index has surged by 100 points in early trading on wall street to hit 25,384 points after gains for healthcare and bank stocks .
connor campbell , an analyst at spreadex , said the index continues `` its remarkable , seemingly unending climb '' .
`` while the ftse ummed and ahhed over hitting new highs , the dow jones was n't as shy , opening at a fresh record peak , '' mr campbell said .
the us ' nasdaq and s & p 500 indexes are also in record territory - just - after rising 0.1 % and 0.2 % respectively .

documents.title: ftse 100 recovers momentum
text: the uk 's ftse 100 share index is back on track to finish at a record high - although it 's likely to be close .
the ftse had a slight wobble in the last hour , but has now recovered to about 7,729 points .
its previous record closing high was set on friday at 7,724.20 .
retailers continue to be among the biggest winners after supermarket chain morrisons impressed the market with its christmas sales figures .

documents.title: which byron restaurants are at risk ?
text: here are the 20 byron burger sites that are at risk of closure as the company looks to go through a restructuring process .
the burger chain has 67 restaurants and employs 1,800 workers , but has said that `` employees will continue to be paid on time and in full '' .

documents.title: byron burger moves to slim down
text: the upmarket burger chain byron is looking to renegotiate its rents and become a `` smaller , more profitable '' business , according to accountancy firm kpmg .
of byron 's 67 restaurants , it plans to keep 51 at current rents , said will wright , restructuring partner at kpmg .
but there are 20 restaurants for which byron will pay almost half rent while it engages with landlords to decide whether to keep trading there , mr wright said .
`` no restaurants will close on day one , and employees , suppliers and business rates will continue to be paid on time and in full , '' he added .

documents.title: breakingbyron could close 20 restaurants
text: byron burger has put 20 restaurants at risk of closure after proposing a restructuring package to shore up its financial position , accountancy firm kpmg has confirmed .

documents.title: can you still take the mail on virgin trains ?
text: yes , is the short answer from the train company .
they just wo n't be selling the daily mail on-the west coast line or providing it in first-class carriages anymore .
in case you 're wondering , virgin 's east coast trains ( which are run in partnership with stagecoach ) already do n't sell the paper .
virgin and stagecoach have faced fierce criticism - including from the daily mail - for being allowed to withdraw from running the service three years early .
critics have said the move could eventually cost the taxpayer billions of pounds - but sir richard last week hit back , saying the deal had cost virgin and stagecoach £ 100m .
hi .
unfortunately my place of work use @ twitterid to ferry us around the country .
will i be allowed to bring my own , pre purchased copy of the @ twitterid on one of your services ?
thanks .
of course you can yes , we just wo n't be retailing it .
^pa
brill .
thanks for conformation
but make sure you remove it from the train with you disembark
i 'm assuming virgin will be providing incinerators .

the train company said it took the decision after listening to feedback from its staff .

documents.title: mail slams virgin trains 'censorship '
text: here is the daily mail 's punchy response to virgin trains ' decision to stop selling the paper on-board its west coast train line carriages .
daily mail responds to virgin trains ban on selling the paper on-board its carriages

documents.title: virgin trains bans daily mail sales
text: virgin trains has stopped stocking the daily mail in its on-board shops or providing it in first-class carriages on one of its main routes , it has emerged .
in an internal memo , the train operator said the paper was `` not compatible '' with its views on issues such as immigration , lgbt rights , and unemployment .

a spokesperson for sir richard branson 's train company said that `` after listening to feedback from our people we have decided that we will no longer stock copies of the daily mail on services on our west coast route '' .
the daily mail branded the move `` censorship '' and said it was `` disgraceful '' at a time when another virgin franchise , the east coast mainline , had to be cut short early .

documents.title: chappell 'locked out ' of bhs
text: former bhs owner dominic chappell says he was unable to meet demands for information from the pensions regulator because he had been locked out of the company when it went into administration .
mr chappell was issued with two section 72 notices on two occasions in april and may 2016 and a third in early 2017 , brighton magistrates court heard .
bhs filed for administration on 25 april 2016 .

documents.title: byron burger chain to launch rescue plan - reports
text: could this be peak burger ?
upmarket burger chain , byron is to launch a company voluntary arrangement ( cva ) tomorrow , in order to secure the firm 's future , according to sky news .
byron wants to close 15 restaurants and renegotiate rents at 20 others .
creditors will vote on the deal at the end of january , the report says .
approval of the cva would pave the way for a new injection of cash .
bryon first opened in 2007 and currently has 70 outlets .

documents.title: aston martin looking to sell shares - reports
text: it 's being reported that aston martin is looking to sell shares on the stock market to raise as much as £ 5bn .
bloomberg reports that talks have been held with advisers .
aston martin plans to move into the suv market and that could bolster interest in a share sale .
the company has reported hefty losses in recent years , but has been successful in raising financing .
aston martin is controlled by several big investors , including italy 's investindustrial and two kuwaiti investment groups .

documents.title: retailers propel ftse 100 higher
text: healthy gains for retail shares are boosting the ftse 100 today .
marks & spencer is up 3.5 % , next is 2.2 % higher and morrisons is up almost 2 % .
investors have been reassured by strong results from morrisons earlier today .
utility firms are the big losers , severn trent is down 2.2 % , united utilities is down 2 % and centrica is off by 1.3 % .
that sector has not been helped by a research note from analysts at exane bnp paribas , who have have rated severn trent shares as `` underperform '' .
overall the ftse 100 remains 0.4 % higher at 7,726 .

documents.title: jamie dimon regrets dissing bitcoin
text: you might remember that back in september the boss of the jp morgan , jamie dimon said that bitcoin was a `` fraud '' .
well he 's now backtracked from those comments , saying in an interview with foxbusiness : `` i regret making them '' .
however , mr dimon said that he is `` not interested '' in the subject of bitcoin .
since late september bitcoin has tripled in value which , no doubt , has made it interesting to some .

text: scotland 's business and economics editor douglas fraser tweets

documents.title: artificially intelligent gadgets at ces
text: `` artificial intelligence '' appears to be the buzz phrase at this year 's ces tech trade show in las vegas .
bbc 's technology correspondent rory cellan-jones saw a suitcase that follows its owner among other gadgets that are boasting machine learning smarts .

documents.title: 'it is essential that uk clarifies its position '
text: speaking of the dutch - their prime minister mark rutte has tweeted after a meeting with eu negotiator michel barnier
spoke with @ twitterid about the second phase of the brexit negotiations .

transition period important to minimize impact on citizens and businesses .

documents.title: dutch court grants rights to stolichnaya vodka brand
text: a dutch appeals court has upheld a lower court ruling , granting rights to the famed stolichnaya vodka brand to russian state-owned spirits maker sojuzplodoimport .
the decision strips the rights from spirits international , owned by the spi group , which is an international consortium that sells alcohol in 160 countries .

stolichnaya was acquired by the exiled russian businessman yuri shefler in 1997 for $ 285,000 from sojuzplodoimport , but four years later the state-backed spirits maker decided it wanted the brand back and sued .
the russian supreme court ruled that the sale was illegal , and mr shefler was prosecuted for misappropriation of trademarks .
he left russia in 2002 .
the decision is a blow for the spi group , which is also facing challenges over the brand in other markets including 13 european union countries , australia and the us .

documents.title: diesel car sales to plunge again
text: the worst is yet to come for diesel cars which will see their sales continue to plunge , a study has warned .
aston university predicts they will account for just 15 % of the uk market by 2025 , down from a 50 % peak .
automotive expert professor david bailey said diesel 's `` slow death '' was being driven by `` environmental pressures and consumer confusion '' .

documents.title: eurozone unemployment edges lower
text: there 's been some upbeat data on the european economy .
the jobless rate among eurozone nations edged lower to 8.7 % in november , down from 8.8 % in october .
in november 2016 it was at 9.8 % .
but there is still a wide divergence in european job markets .
unemployment in greece is still above 20 % , while in germany it is just 3.6 % .
but compared with a year earlier greece did register the biggest fall in unemployment rate among european union nations - down from 23.2 % to 20.5 % .

documents.title: why is games workshop doing so well ?
text: analysts at peel hunt credit the revamp of its social media use :
`` games workshop has belatedly embraced online and social media , which has had a major impact on the hobby and the company 's relationship with hobbyists .
`` there has been a move to greater engagement and enjoyment as well as much improved product marketing .
`` the numbers are impressive with 2.5 million users and 16.3 million views of the online content in the period .
`` the company recently introduced its own videos rather than relying on hobbyists to develop and post material .
`` these videos now reach 100,000 people per day and directly drive revenues .
this is only the start and greater customer engagement should drive greater awareness of the hobby and grow the warhammer globally .

documents.title: games workshop hails 'cracking ' results
text: games workshop , which makes fantasy miniature figures , has reported record sales and profits for the first half of the year .
sales in the six months to 28 november jumped 54 % to £ 108.9m and profits almost tripled to £ 38.8m .
the company described the results as `` cracking '' .

documents.title: you 've got less to spend - officially
text: the office for national statistics has released data on the disposable income of uk households .
economics correspondent andrew verity tweets :
national disposable income has grown ( nndi ) but real household disposable income ( rhdi ) has shrunk .
one reason is that corporations and the government are taking a greater share of the country 's income - while households get less :
3 million mortgage prisoners paying £ 300 per month more than they should have for almost 8 years has been single largest squeeze on household disposable income .
must be addressed now !
though we already know that 'net social benefits ' in the future are going to be squeezed , so i doubt this will be a pretty over coming years .
@ twitterid what abt @ twitterid promise to help the 'just-about-managing ' ?
@ pjtheeconomist @ twitterid
who knew ?

documents.title: political worries blamed for pound weakness
text: the pound had dipped against the dollar this morning .
it 's down four tenths of a cent at $ 1.35290 .

some analysts are saying there 's been a reaction to the reshuffle of senior figures in the government , which commentators have said was a bit of a shambles and has undermined the authority of prime minister theresa may .
it 's worth bearing in mind though that the pound is around 12 % higher than it was this time last year , when it was trading as low as $ 1.20 .

documents.title: how do you prevent counterfeit goods online ?
text: snapdragon is a firm that specialises in helping small businesses monitor and protect their intellectual property from counterfeiters .
rachel jones , founder and chief executive of snapdragon , figured out how to stop chinese firms from profiting through the sales of a high chair she invented .
now she uses the skills she learned to help other firms , and in 2016 prevented $ 10bn worth of counterfeit goods .
`` we make it incredibly difficult for them to sell the product , '' she explains to bbc business live .
`` any bonafide portal must take down and prevent counterfeit goods from being sold .
if you are incredibly tenacious and you keep reporting people , saying that the product ca n't be sold , then you 're cutting off the sales channel , so they go away and do something else . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: why is morrisons on the up ?
text: morrisons ' success is down to the changes it has made into processes and online shopping , molly johnson-jones , senior analyst at globaldata tells bbc business live .
`` with david potts , the new ceo , for the last two years he 's implemented a turnaround programme which has meant that they 've played catch-up with the other supermarkets , '' she said .
`` so they 've invested in online , they 've gone into supply deals , such as with mccoll 's , with amazon .
they 've improved the store , they 've improved the supply chain in terms of getting things automated . ''
in future , globaldata expects some like-for-like retail slowdown , but for now it thinks morrisons is in a good position for 2018 .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: fat times for fatface
text: fashion retailer fatface had a strong holiday period .
for the five weeks to 6 january like-for-like sales were up 8 % .
total sales rose by 12 % .
the week ending 30 december was the retailers ' best ever week .

documents.title: why is the uk lagging behind europe ?
text: world stock markets have seen their most promising start to a year since 2006 , yet money flowing into uk assets is at 40-year low , according to latest data from merrill lynch .
`` it 's because of brexit and the political uncertainty in the uk , '' george godber , fund manager at polar capital tells bbc business live .
`` it 's the worries investors have over a corybn government and what that might mean for the uk economy and uk market .
that hangs over , and the cabinet reshuffle shows that .
`` investors are not putting their money into the uk and actually it 's creating opportunities for the uk because everyone is looking the other way . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: japan 's nikkei closes at highest level since 1991
text: asia 's share rally continues with japan 's benchmark index closing at its highest level in more than 26 years .
the nikkei 225 index added 0.5 % to finish tuesday at 23,850 points .
this was partly down to investors playing catch-up after the market was closed for a public holiday on monday .
but analysts also suggested that seemingly positive talks between north and south korea - easing tensions in the region - also accounted for the positivity .
the nikkei last reached such dizzying highs in november 1991 - a time when vic reeves and the wonderstuff were top of the uk charts with , er , dizzy .
elsewhere south korea 's kospi index lost ground , closing 0.1 % lower .
that was dragged down by samsung electronics which fell 3.1 % after missing analysts expectations with its fourth quarter profits forecast .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: markets : ftse 100 up ; morrisons surges
text: the ftse 100 has made early gains , it 's up by 0.3 % .
supermarket morrisons ' shares are up almost 5 % , after reporting healthy sales over the holiday trading period .
meanwhile , the ftse 250 has also moved higher .
shares in troubled services and construction group carillion have fallen almost 6 % , following a 20 % surge yesterday .
majestic wine is up 0.2 % after its latest trading statement .

documents.title: shoppers spent £ 1bn more on groceries over christmas
text: latest figures from kantar worldpanel show that british shoppers spent £ 1bn more in supermarkets over the christmas trading period , compared to the same period in the year before .
overall supermarket sales were up 3.8 % for the 12 weeks to 31 december 2017 , with the busiest shopping day ever recorded on 22 december , when shoppers spent £ 747m .
sales of mince pies rose by 13.2 % year-on-year , while alcohol sales grew by 5.1 % compared to the same period in 2016 .

despite tightening household budgets , shoppers continued to trade up to more expensive options : a record £ 469 million was spent on premium own label lines in december alone with chilled items , fresh meat and bakery featuring prominently .
tesco was the fastest growing of the big four supermarkets , with sales up 3.1 % during the 12 week period .
as for the discount retailers , aldi and lidl tied at the top with both growing sales by 16.8 % year-on-year .

documents.title: a chat with sophia
text: at the consumer electronics show in las vegas , bbc 's technology reporter zoe kleinman had a chat with sophia , a new humanoid robot by hanson robotics .
the firm is aiming to `` bring machines to life '' by building robots that can communicate effectively with humans .

documents.title: persimmon : 'huge dollop of luck '
text: the chief executive of persimmon jeff fairburn is in line to collect a bonus of more than £ 100m .
it 's the result of a pay deal put in place five years ago .
the final total depends on how persimmon shares perform .
`` the plan was flawed in that there was no upper limit to it , '' said ruth bender , professor of corporate financial strategy at cranfield school of management .
`` although he has done a good job at the top of the company , it 's happened because the government changed the regulations and they 've had a huge dollop of luck from help to buy . ''
`` there is obviously an element of good management in it , but they would have never made those good results without the regulation . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'great ' performance from morrisons
text: steve dresser is a retail analyst .
growth on growth from morrisons and we thought last year 's figures would have been difficult to match .
all credit to them on a great performance .

strong performance from morrisons now starkly brings in to focus the sainsbury 's performance , especially as they were more competitive on spirits , christmas veg and wines than they were the year before .

documents.title: strong sales from persimmon
text: house-builder persimmon has reported an increase in revenue in its trading update on tuesday .
revenue for 2017 were £ 3.4bn , up 9 % on the previous year , with completed deals up by 6 % or 872 new homes .
the group 's average selling price increased by 3 % to £ 213,300 , compared to £ 206,765 in 2016 .
persimmon said it acquired 17,300 plots of new land at `` excellent margins '' in over 80 locations throughout the uk in 2017 .
`` we remain mindful of market risks including those associated with the uncertainty arising from the uk leaving the eu , '' the firm said .

documents.title: breakingmajestic wine sales rose over christmas
text: majestic wine has announced that its group sales for the 10-week christmas trading period ending 1 january 2018 rose by 3.2 % compared to the same period in the previous year .
it says that sales for majestic retail were up 1.3 % like-for-like , and that it remains on track to achieve current market expectations .
majestic wine 's chief executive rowan gormley said the company was `` on track '' to meet its sales and investment goals for this year .

documents.title: breakingmorrisons reports solid holiday sales
text: morrisons has reported respectable sales growth over the holiday period .
for the ten weeks to 7 january like-for-like sales ( excluding fuel ) were up 2.8 % .
if you take the 6 weeks to 7 january then the performance was even better - like-for-like sales were up 3.7 % .

documents.title: a rise in retailers going bust
text: according to deloitte , there has been a 28 % rise of retailers going bust , as 92 firms filed for administration in 2017 .
`` the vibrancy and resilience of the market is really important for us all .
so making sure consumers have the choice of the right products at the right price at the right time is part of the greatness of the offer to consumers .
if that comes under pressure , than it 's a worry , '' says helen dickinson , the chief executive of the british retail consortium .
`` [ the deloitte figures show ] a worrying trend that highlights there 's a pressure that 's being put on a market that is n't growing very quickly , where costs are growing more quickly .
`` because retailers are having to invest a lot in digital and change lots of them are doing that really well , but others are not able to keep pace with that rate of change . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: what will drones be useful for ?
text: the drone market continues to grow , and although regulation is still being decided , many in the industry see business potential for the technology .
major global accountancy firm pricewaterhousecoopers have appointed elaine white as uk drones leader - a newly-created role .
`` drones are useful because they 're a way of capturing data that will give business a powerful advantage , '' she tells wake up to money .
`` if we translate this over into large infrastructure project , you could use a drone periodically to travel over a large landscape .
you can check your progress is going to plan you can create a comprehensive record that can be used in disputes later .
`` i predict this will become business as usual in this space . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: kids should only have an hour on smartphones
text: teenagers who spend on hour a day on a phone are the happiest and more than two or three hours should be the limit , says psychology professor jean twenge .
she is giving advice to an investment firm which is calling on apple to make a bigger effort to protect young people .
there is some evidence that the over-use of electronic devices is damaging to the mental health of children and teenagers .
professor twenge said that one answer would be that during the set-up of a smartphone it would ask how old the user is .
at that stage the parent would have the opportunity to limit the apps available on the phone , limit the amount of time it is used for and shut it down at a certain time of night .
more and more silicon valley executives are expressing concern over the amount of time spent on devices , professor twenge says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: samsung 'at heart of technological advancements '
text: why is samsung doing so well , despite a difficult 2017 which was a massive recall of its flagship galaxy note 7 smartphone ?

`` the dram chips which are going into everyone 's smartphones continue to be in extraordinary demand , and samsung is right at the heart of technological development of this part of the market and that 's what it 's benefiting from , '' chris ralph , chief investment officer at st james place wealth management tells wake up to money .
and even though western markets like the us and the uk might already have peak smartphone penetration , there is still a lot of opportunity in other markets , he says .
`` if you look at the growing use of smartphones in india and china , the fact [ is ] , it 's completely replaced fixed line telephony . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: samsung set for another record profit
text: its top executive is in jail for corruption and one of its flagship phones became a laughing stock after batteries caught fire .
but you would n't know it from the bottom line .
samsung electronics says it expects to deliver record profits for the last three months of 2017 - of 15.1 trillion won ( $ 14.1bn ; £ 10.4bn ) - up 64 % from a year earlier .
the strong demand for its microchips lies behind the success .
official figures will come out in a few weeks time but past experience tells us that these estimates are usually pretty much bang on .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: split in the retail sector
text: overall total retail sales were a bit higher in december compared with the previous year , up almost one and a half percent .
but that number hides a split says helen dickinson , the chief executive of the british retail consortium ( brc ) .
food retailers saw growth , partly reflecting higher inflation which , in turn , is driven by the weaker pound .
but in non-food sales it is a much gloomier like-for-like non-food sales fell 4 % in december .
ms dickinson says that falling disposable income is leaving shoppers with less money to spend on non-essential items .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: should there be a cap on bonuses ?
text: persimmon homes ' chief executive is going is receive a bonus of over £ 100m in a previously-agreed share rewards scheme that was set up in 2012 .
some shareholders are unhappy about this and feel that there should be a cap .

ruth bender , professor of corporate financial strategy at the cranfield school of management , explains to bbc radio 5 live 's wake up to money programme that the scheme was set up when the house-building market was down , in order to incentivise executive directors to generate more profits .
`` over 80 % of [ shareholders ] signed off it .

generally many of them are n't that interested for many of them , it was an options scheme that rewarded cash and profits , they understood that , and no one really thought there should be a cap on it , '' she says .
however , she does believe that the bonus is a result of the booming housing market and a government change in policy .
`` you should be incentivising good stuff , but this has been a reward for good luck .
you should n't be rewarding people for a government change in policy . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: intel to make flawed chips safe in a week
text: intel 's chief executive has said software fixes to address the recently discovered meltdown and spectre bugs in microchips would be released in the next few days .
brian krzanich was speaking at the beginning of his keynote speech at the ces trade show event in las vegas .
he said 90 % of processors and products from the past five years would be patched `` within a week '' .
read more here .

documents.title: gopro pulling out of drone market
text: gopro , which is known for its action cameras , has announced that it is exiting the drone market and will be cutting its staff by a fifth .
the firm said revenue fell almost 40 % in the fourth quarter to $ 340m compared to the same period in 2016 .
it 's a great little company , started in silicon valley by surfers , used by surfers .
i always thought , if everyone who wants an action camera has one , where do you go from there ? , '' said bbc 's technology correspondent rory cellan-jones .
`` then they became a social media company , then got into drones but they were too late . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live .
this morning , we 're looking at how retailers performed in december - the british retail consortium says that lots of retailers ended up discounting before christmas .
the consumer electronic show ( ces ) tech trade show is currently on in las vegas and there are lots of technological advances being touted , particularly involving artificial intelligence .
and in other news , the markets have seen the most promising start to the year since 2006 .
looking ahead , house builder persimmon will be putting out its results today , as well as supermarket morrisons and majestic wine .
